sourceMeaningMnemonic: You give a <radical>bow</radical> and a <radical>stick</radical> to your friend's family. This is because your friend died, and he loved bows and sticks. You give this to his family, to give our <kanji>condolence</kanji>s.
meaningInfo: Imagine looking at the bow and stick as you slide them over to your deceased friend's family. This won't do enough, but it is a little condolence at least.
readingMnemonic: More than a <kanji>condolence</kanji>, you want to avenge your friend's death. He was killed by Mrs. <reading>Chou</reading> (<ja>ちょう</ja>), and she broke his stick and bow, which is why you got the family a new set.
readingInfo: Imagine her saying, "My condolences," as Mrs. Chou does him in.
